channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: Hedgehog of Death ( prototype leather sculpture )
item.description: Hedgehog of Death (prototype leather sculpture): It was created in the image of between an art object and a toy. It can be decorate a room as a stylish interior, or It can be a fun toy to pause changing. This themes are Leather and metal. The excessive heavy exterior protects your own weakness by armor wrap. I thought there might be something people can relate to their feeling always. I made this in consideration of "mode". And I aimed to the extreme thing of heavy and hard. But I'll take more different approach in next time.
item.content:encoded: Hedgehog of Death (prototype leather sculpture): It was created in the image of between an art object and a toy. It can be decorate a room as a stylish interior, or It can be a fun toy to pause changing. This themes are Leather and metal. The excessive heavy exterior protects your own weakness by armor wrap. I thought there might be something people can relate to their feeling always. I made this in consideration of "mode". And I aimed to the extreme thing of heavy and hard. But I'll take more different approach in next time.

item.title: CODE Pro
item.description: Code Pro is a font family inspired by the original Sans Serif fonts like Avant Garde or Futura, but with a modern twist. It is clean, elegant and straight-to-the-point. Code font is applicable for any type of graphic designweb, print, motion graphics, etc.and perfect for t-shirts and other items like posters and logos.
item.content:encoded: Code Pro is a font family inspired by the original Sans Serif fonts like Avant Garde or Futura, but with a modern twist. It is clean, elegant and straight-to-the-point. Code font is applicable for any type of graphic designweb, print, motion graphics, etc.and perfect for t-shirts and other items like posters and logos.

item.title: Fabulous & She Can DJ
item.description: Lady on the right side created for one of the biggest indoor festival of the year in the Netherland and Las Vegas. Four different areas with the world's best techno, club house, electro and the latest trance music. Chica on the left is created for upcoming DJ comp to find the hottest new female DJ/Producer talent in Australia and New Zealand. Illustration designed for EMI Music Australasia.
item.content:encoded: Lady on the right side created for one of the biggest indoor festival of the year in the Netherland and Las Vegas. Four different areas with the world's best techno, club house, electro and the latest trance music. Chica on the left is created for upcoming DJ comp to find the hottest new female DJ/Producer talent in Australia and New Zealand. Illustration designed for EMI Music Australasia.

item.title: PRINT
item.description: Current and past clients include: I.D. Magazine, Seed Magazine, Harry N. Abrams, Columbia University, University of California Berkeley, School of Visual Arts.
item.content:encoded: Current and past clients include: I.D. Magazine, Seed Magazine, Harry N. Abrams, Columbia University, University of California Berkeley, School of Visual Arts.

item.title: PERSONA by Jeffrey Wang ??
item.description: The main purpose of this project PERSONA was to use recycled denim jeans and create art pieces from it. In creating this project I think it was very important that we kept the "raw" personality of denim jeans and applying it like a sculpture so there was no cutting, sewing or any use of fashion technical skills. The only thing used to hold the jeans together were safety pins. In staying true to the shape and personality of denim jeans, even if we took it apart all the jeans still hold it's original shape and can still be worn, a true recyclable project.
item.content:encoded: The main purpose of this project PERSONA was to use recycled denim jeans and create art pieces from it. In creating this project I think it was very important that we kept the "raw" personality of denim jeans and applying it like a sculpture so there was no cutting, sewing or any use of fashion technical skills. The only thing used to hold the jeans together were safety pins. In staying true to the shape and personality of denim jeans, even if we took it apart all the jeans still hold it's original shape and can still be worn, a true recyclable project.
